description: A golden castle with Art Nouveau-inspired architecture serving as the headquarters of the Accino Family. Despite being located in the frozen Hyokaido region, Lovely Land has a tropical atmosphere with jungle environment created by Don Accino's heat-generating Devil Fruit powers. The castle houses Don Accino's collection of pirate flags taken from captured bounties.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Discovers Lovely Land
keyEvents.description: Roronoa Zoro stumbles upon Lovely Land while wandering through a blizzard, discovering the golden castle headquarters of the Accino Family.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the main base of operations for the arc's antagonists and sets the stage for the climactic confrontation.

statusHistory.reason: Castle is operational and serving as Accino Family headquarters

description: A vast frozen region in Paradise filled with icebergs and glaciers that have formed over hundreds of years. The geography features various waterways for ships to pass through, but the icebergs move unnaturally due to Domo Penguins pushing them from underwater. This allows the Accino Family to trap ships between icebergs. Deep within Hyokaido lies Lovely Land, the Accino Family's golden castle headquarters. The name is likely a reference to Hokkaido, the northernmost main island of Japan.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Domo Penguins Moving Icebergs
keyEvents.description: Nami and Franky discover underwater that Domo Penguins are physically pushing the icebergs, revealing the mechanism behind the Accino Family's trap.
keyEvents.significance: Explains how the Accino Family controls the iceberg movements to trap their prey.

keyEvents.title: The Great Battle on Ice Begins
keyEvents.description: Multiple simultaneous battles between Straw Hats and Accino Family members take place across Hyokaido's frozen terrain.
keyEvents.significance: Hyokaido serves as the battlefield for the arc's major conflicts.

statusHistory.reason: Frozen archipelago remains active throughout Ice Hunter Arc
